PW

Please answer a couple of quesions for me:

1) Do you have any printers installed (using CUPS), and if so, can you print to them from another application?

2) What version of GTK are you using? (rpm -q gtk2)

Please also read bug 153936, and see if making any of the changes mentioned there (change to KDE if you are using Gnome, upgrade to a newer 2.10.x gtk, update your CUPS install, ...) make any difference for you.

> 1) Do you have any printers installed (using CUPS),

I haven't gotten to that part yet. Starting the printer panel from the Desktop I see an empty queue. The menu lists filters for All printers, Fax, PDF, PostScript and eMail PDF. Firefox offers to print to PostScript only. Ksysguard lists a CUPSD process.

Printing from Konqueror results in an Error telling me (translated back from German):
Error while loading printer list:
No Connection to CUPS-Server. Please check that CUPS-Server is installed and active.
Cause: IPP-Request failed due to unknown reasons.


> 2) What version of GTK are you using? (rpm -q gtk2)

gtk2-2.10.6-24.2

> Please also read bug 153936, and see if making any of the changes mentioned
> there (change to KDE if you are using Gnome, upgrade to a newer 2.10.x gtk,
> update your CUPS install, ...) make any difference for you.

That bug sounds quite familiar to me :-/

I'm already running KDE 3.5.5 "release 45.2"

I was a little confused today ... in the tray there is an Update-Mini-Program, that told me, there are no new updates available. Nevertheless, I've updated with Yast from the root-account and got some 60 packages including CUPS cups-1.2.7-12.1

In addition I've installed Java via Yast:

java version "1.5.0_10"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_10-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_10-b03, mixed mode)

which is the latest Sun-JDK I found through Yast on the openSUSE servers.

It automatically replaced the 1.5.0_11 which I downloaded from sun directly. Maybe I made a fault in installing the jdk 1.5.0_11 and perhaps the same mistake when installing jdk 1.6.0-b105 yesterday.

But the good news is. I just ran M3 successfully and could create a new Java-Project and Java-Test-Class. Just to be sure I opened the print dialog, that offered printing to a file :-)

Now I switched to M4 and hold your breath ... It's not working! This time I cannot even create a project. Other than the NullPointerException in the second attachment (M3 Java 6), this time (M4 Java 5_10) I did not even get the question, what kind of project I want to set up. (I'll attach the log) The toolbar-button for calling the creation-wizard is just grayed out. I gets color, on mouse over.

I conclude with a wild guess: Is 512 MB physical RAM and 1 GB SWAP insufficient for running eclipse?

Carolyn, this just causes us to pick bottom, it shouldn't effect the workflow or results.

PW

The NPE is coming from us trying to update the default compiler compliance options based on the JRE he starting the workspace with. I have not seen this problem before, but does look like a bug on our part. I suggest to try using a 1.4 or 1.5 VM to avoid this (looks like he's using 1.6). I'll file a bug against debug for this.

(In reply to comment #13)
> I suggest to try using a
> 1.4 or 1.5 VM to avoid this (looks like he's using 1.6). I'll file a bug
> against debug for this.

I started with
Java 1.6.0-b105 directly from Sun -> attachment 1 and 2
Downgraded to 1.5.0_11-b03 also a download from Sun -> attachment 3
Last I switched to 1.5.0_10-b03 via Yast Update from openSUSE servers -> attachment 4

3.3M3 is working on 1.5.0_10-b03 (without intensive testing) so thats my choice for the weekend, because I have to present something on Monday ...

Created an attachment (id=58832)
java.lang.Exception 3.3 M4 with jdk_1.5.0_10-b03

I have to apologize! Finally I found the reason for my memory shortage. There definitely is a SWAP-Partition. But somehow it just wasn't activated. So attachment 1 to 4 should all be hidden memory-issues, that just did not come up with the correct OutOfMemoryException.

Moreover I found out, that M3 would run with -Xmx150m but throw Exceptions at -Xmx180m whereas java refused to load the VM at -Xmx220m (without SWAP on 512 MB RAM).

But not to give you the impression of having finished ... M3 is now running from the launcher, but still I cannot run M4 and this time I double checked the memory:

Linux-Host:/usr/java # free
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:        516220     508968       7252          0      34648     161744
-/+ buffers/cache:     312576     203644
Swap:      1032184         76    1032108

Any idea on this?

BTW: This Exception is the same for the launcher and by runnig java -jar startup.jar directly except for the logged times and commandline-arguments.

Moving to Update. This no longer has anything to do with printing, and the stack trace in comment 15 looks like some kind of update problem. Unless it's a core problem (missing bundle). Note that Holger has been switching vms and eclipse versions to try to solve the problem, and may not be in a clean state (not sure).

I did another update today, switching back to Java 6 in line with some automatic updates from OpenSUSE. Now 3.3 M4 is running even from the launcher.

Well, I'm quite happy to have it running now. But maybe the reports might help you to nail down other problems.

Thanks for your attention
